flawed_nl_solution:
Store A has a $125 x 8/100 = $<<125*8/100=10>>10 discount.
So the smartphone from store A will only cost $125 - $10 = $<<125-10=115>>115.
Store B has a $130 x 10/100 = $<<130*10/100=1300/1>>1300/1 discount.
So the smartphone from store B will only cost $130 - $1300/1 = $<<130-1300/1=-1170>>-1170.
Thus, store A's smartphone is $-1170 - $115 = $<<-1170-115=-1285>>-1285 cheaper than that of store B.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 13, not 1300/1. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
